[SYNTAX]: Archaisms and overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "did good service to his successors") may impede modern readability.
[LEXICON]: Less common vocabulary (e.g., "chequered," "preciosity") requires extra cognitive effort.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unconnected paragraphs (e.g., Bahá’u’lláh, Reynolds) disrupt thematic continuity.
[TRANSITION]: No logical bridges between disparate topics (e.g., Egyptology to art history).

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structure in "It was in his nineteenth year..."
[CLARITY]: Unclear antecedent for "his" in "his nineteenth year"

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unrelated shifts between ancient Egypt, 19th-century social commentary, and a biographical anecdote
[TRANSITION]: Complete lack of transitional links between topics
